 -Justifications : kus|Type|Robot, Robot|SubClassOf|Agent, kus|hasCapability|zlp, PerceivingCapability|SubClassOf|(isCapabilityOf some (hasComponent some Camera), zlp|isCapabilityOf|kus, kus|hasComponent|fc, fc|Type|Webcam, Webcam|SubClassOf|Camera, qa|Type|Box, Box|SubClassOf|Object, qa|hasDisposition|x, PerceivingDisposition|EquivalentTo|(isDispositionOf some (hasPart some ScannablePart)), x|isDispositionOf|qa, qa|hasPart|tlzn, tlzn|Type|QRCode, QRCode|SubClassOf|ScannablePart, qa|isVisibleBy|kus, fc|Type|Webcam, Webcam|SubClassOf|Camera, kus|hasComponent|fc, fc|hasMaximumDistanceRange|integer#33, qa|isAtDistance|integer#32, greaterThan(integer#33,integer#32). -Rule : Agent(?a), hasCapability(?a, ?c), PerceivingCapability(?c), Object(?o), hasDisposition(?o, ?d), PerceivingDisposition(?d),                 isVisibleBy(?o,?a), Camera(?g), hasComponent(?a,?g), hasMaximumDistanceRange(?g,?w1), isAtDistance(?o,?w2), greaterThan(?w1,?w2) -> canPerceive(?a, ?o).
answers.answer: the robot can perceive the box because it has a perceiving capability based on its webcam component, which allows it to see the box from a distance within its range, and the box being at a distance that is less than the webcam's maximum detection range.

answers.question:
-Inference : x|canPerceive|wfuj 
 -Justifications : x|Type|Robot, Robot|SubClassOf|Agent, x|hasCapability|dsgc, PerceivingCapability|SubClassOf|(isCapabilityOf some (hasComponent some Camera), dsgc|isCapabilityOf|x, x|hasComponent|c, c|Type|RealsenseL515, RealsenseL515|SubClassOf|Camera, wfuj|Type|Cube, Cube|SubClassOf|Object, wfuj|hasDisposition|a, PerceivingDisposition|EquivalentTo|(isDispositionOf some (hasPart some ScannablePart)), a|isDispositionOf|wfuj, wfuj|hasPart|k, k|Type|QRTag, QRTag|SubClassOf|ScannablePart, wfuj|isVisibleBy|x, c|Type|RealsenseL515, RealsenseL515|SubClassOf|Camera, x|hasComponent|c, c|hasMaximumDistanceRange|integer#74, wfuj|isAtDistance|integer#67, greaterThan(integer#74,integer#67). -Rule : Agent(?a), hasCapability(?a, ?c), PerceivingCapability(?c), Object(?o), hasDisposition(?o, ?d), PerceivingDisposition(?d),                 isVisibleBy(?o,?a), Camera(?g), hasComponent(?a,?g), hasMaximumDistanceRange(?g,?w1), isAtDistance(?o,?w2), greaterThan(?w1,?w2) -> canPerceive(?a, ?o).
answers.answer: the robot can perceive the cube because it has a perceiving capability based on its camera component, which is capable of scanning objects at a distance within its range, and the cube is visible to the robot and at a distance from it.
